metadata.title: USN-6435-1 -- OpenSSL vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was discovered that OpenSSL incorrectly handled excessively large Diffie-Hellman parameters. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2023-3446)  Bernd Edlinger discovered that OpenSSL incorrectly handled excessively large Diffie-Hellman parameters. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2023-3817)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6435-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libssl-dev - 1.0.2g-1ubuntu4.20+esm10 openssl - 1.0.2g-1ubuntu4.20+esm10 libssl-doc - 1.0.2g-1ubuntu4.20+esm10 libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.2g-1ubuntu4.20+esm10 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
